conclusion: I'll solve this step-by-step by analyzing the forces acting on the charged ball at equilibrium.

There are three forces acting on the charged ball: Gravitational force ($F_g = mg$) acting downward, Tension force ($T$) acting along the string, Electric force ($F_e = qE$) acting horizontally (assuming rightward in the diagram).

premise: Since the ball is at rest, the net force on it must be zero.
conclusion: I'll analyze this in the horizontal and vertical components.
For the horizontal components: Electric force: $qE$ (rightward), Horizontal component of tension: $T\sin\theta$ (leftward).
For the vertical components: Gravitational force: $mg$ (downward), Vertical component of tension: $T\cos\theta$ (upward).
